metadata.title: CVE-2018-20761 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
GPAC version 0.7.1 and earlier has a Buffer Overflow vulnerability in thegf_sm_load_init function in scene_manager.c in libgpac_static.a.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20761` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpac - 0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1
gpac-modules-base - 0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1
libgpac2 - 0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gpac package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.5.0+svn4288~dfsg1-4ubuntu1+esm1').
